-NyNoMPGs4PeSI6S_rbw.title: Broccoli Salad
-NyNoMPGs4PeSI6S_rbw.ingredients: 5-6 cups broccoli florets (approx 2.5 heads of broccoli), 2/3 cup dried cranberries, 1/2 cup crumbled bacon, 1/2 cup sunflower seeds, 1/3 cup red onion, 3/4 jar of poppyseed dressing
-NyNoMPGs4PeSI6S_rbw.directions: chop up broccoli florets to desired, mix all ingredients (minus dressing) together in a large bowl, then add dressing to desired consistency
-NyNoMPGs4PeSI6S_rbw.author: Grams

-NyNoMPIR8e7F_Bdc9OM.title: Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream
-NyNoMPIR8e7F_Bdc9OM.description: The best dessert without all the crap!
-NyNoMPIR8e7F_Bdc9OM.ingredients: 8 eggs, 2.5 cups white sugar, 5 pints half & half, 4 tbsp real vanilla, 1/2 tsp salt, whole milk, ice, ice cream salt
-NyNoMPIR8e7F_Bdc9OM.directions: Mix all ingredients together minus whole milk. Add mixture to inside container of ice cream maker. Fill remaining space to fill line with whole milk. Place top and add to outer container of ice cream maker. Secure motorized turner to top. Add ice and ice cream salt between the two containers, turn on. Periodically check to see if more ice is needed. Ice cream maker will slow down as it gets thicker. Periodically check until desired thickness is reached.
-NyNoMPIR8e7F_Bdc9OM.author: Lois Hicks

-NyNoMPKCWhUKnDvY7YU.title: Homemade Noodles
-NyNoMPKCWhUKnDvY7YU.description: These homemade noodles warm the heart and the stomach. Plus they don't get soggy like typical egg noodles!
-NyNoMPKCWhUKnDvY7YU.ingredients: 8 eggs, white flour, wheat flour, salt, pepper
-NyNoMPKCWhUKnDvY7YU.directions: Add eggs to bowl & mix well, add salt/pepper, slowly add in 1/4 cup of each flour, mix until dough is formed somewhat into a ball, but still sticky. Place 1-2 cups of white flour on clean counter, add 1/4-1/2 of the dough onto the flour. Slowly kneed the flour into the dough evenly until it no longer sticks to the counter (be careful not to over kneed). Check the underneath of the dough frequently to make sure it doesn't stick to the counter. Roll out to desired depth with rolling pin. Transfer to drying place. After approx 2-3 hours, cut dough into desired shapes. The longer the dough drys, the better they taste!
-NyNoMPKCWhUKnDvY7YU.author: Grandma Geiber

-NyNoMPN1Zbn6Jd6fPrW.title: Potato Soup
-NyNoMPN1Zbn6Jd6fPrW.description: What's better than warm soup on a cold day? This simple potato soup recipe will hit the spot anytime.
-NyNoMPN1Zbn6Jd6fPrW.ingredients: 6-8 russet potatoes, 1 lbs bacon, 1 cup shredded carrots, 2 tbsp corn starch, 1/2 cup milk, pinch salt/pepper, 1 tbsp onion powder, 1 tbsp garlic powder, 1 cup chicken bone broth
-NyNoMPN1Zbn6Jd6fPrW.directions: Place dutch oven on stove and turn to high, cook bacon until desired doneness is achieved, once bacon is cooked, remove (leave bacon grease for flavor) and transfer to plate with paper towel; wash and peel potatoes, cut potatoes into small cubes; add 4-5 cups water, 1 cup chicken broth, seasonings to dutch oven, bring to boil, add potatoes and carrots, cook until potatoes are tender; in a separate container mix corn startch and milk together using emulsion blender, slowly add mixture to dutch oven to thicken soup. Cook for another 5-10 mins. Pour into bowl, add bacon and enjoy!
-NyNoMPN1Zbn6Jd6fPrW.author: Lois Hicks

-NyNoMPP_HmjFppVgNwh.title: Roast Beef, Carrots & Potatoes
-NyNoMPP_HmjFppVgNwh.ingredients: desired size chuck roast (has to fit pan with room for veggies), 1 16 oz package baby carrots, 4-5 large russet potatoes, 2 15 oz can beef broth
-NyNoMPP_HmjFppVgNwh.directions: peel and wash potatoes, season chuck roast with salt/pepper, add all ingredients to roaster pan, ensure roast/veggies are covered in liquid (add water if needed), cover, bake at 250 degrees for 6-8 hours or until carrots are tender
-NyNoMPP_HmjFppVgNwh.author: Carol Whitehead
